**Yellow dragon scales** are a type of [body armor](/wiki/Body_armor "Body armor") that appear in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. They are made of [dragon hide](/wiki/Dragon_hide "Dragon hide") like all [dragon scales](/wiki/Dragon_scales "Dragon scales").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [5.2 SporkHack](#SporkHack)
  - [5.3 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [5.4 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [5.5 FIQHack](#FIQHack)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

Yellow dragon scales are not randomly generated, though they can be [wished](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for or found in [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones").

A [yellow dragon](/wiki/Yellow_dragon "Yellow dragon") that leaves a [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") behind on death (i.e. always, unless killed by [disintegration](/wiki/Disintegration "Disintegration")) has a 1⁄3 chance of leaving behind dragon scales, while a dragon revived by the [wand of undead turning](/wiki/Wand_of_undead_turning "Wand of undead turning") or [spell of turn undead](/wiki/Spell_of_turn_undead "Spell of turn undead") only has a 1⁄20 chance to leave behind scales.[\[1\]](#cite_note-scalegen-1) Yellow dragon scales dropped this way are always generated +0 and uncursed.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

## Description

While worn, yellow dragon scales confer 3 base [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") and [acid resistance](/wiki/Acid_resistance "Acid resistance"). Reading a non-cursed [scroll of enchant armor](/wiki/Scroll_of_enchant_armor "Scroll of enchant armor") that targets worn yellow dragon scales will convert them into [yellow dragon scale mail](/wiki/Yellow_dragon_scale_mail "Yellow dragon scale mail"), with a blessed scroll adding a point of [enchantment](/wiki/Enchantment "Enchantment").

Uncontrolled [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") while wearing yellow dragon scales will turn the wearer into a yellow dragon, and doing so while wearing the scale mail will additionally revert them to scales.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit 9942b65d](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/9942b65df78dd55a7806ec), extrinsic sources of an elemental resistance now has a 99⁄100 chance of protecting your inventory from that type of damage. Per [commit ef1eeed7](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/ef1eeed7550e38fa1e4ff0ef608f3c8b55eaa950), both the scales and scale mail also provide [stoning resistance](/wiki/Stoning_resistance "Stoning resistance").

## Strategy

- *Main article: [Dragon scales#Strategy](/wiki/Dragon_scales#Strategy "Dragon scales")*

Yellow dragon scales are perhaps the least likely to be sought out: acid resistance cannot be obtained intrinsically without polymorph, and [acid](/wiki/Acid "Acid") damage can be annoying to deal with (especially in terms of inventory damage), but many acidic monsters are either non-threatening and/or can be dealt with at range. The biggest acidic threats are the yellow dragon, whose breath can be blocked with [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection"), and the [Chromatic Dragon](/wiki/Chromatic_Dragon "Chromatic Dragon"), who has several breath weapons that are more immediately dangerous than acid. Even for characters that have constant trouble with acid, an [alchemy smock](/wiki/Alchemy_smock "Alchemy smock") will suffice if they have an open [cloak](/wiki/Cloak "Cloak") slot.

[Mind flayer](/wiki/Mind_flayer "Mind flayer") pets and others with multiple attacks will most appreciate yellow scales, and characters opting to stick to a polyform with multiple attacks (e.g. [speed ascension](/wiki/Speed_ascension "Speed ascension") play as a [master mind flayer](/wiki/Master_mind_flayer "Master mind flayer")) may also consider wearing the scales to make into mail.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Yellow dragon scales are somewhat more likely to be considered for some characters since it confers extrinsic acid resistance and stoning resistance: they provide a source of acid damage protection for the inventory, and stoning resistance allows easier disposal of threats such as [cockatrices](/wiki/Cockatrice "Cockatrice") without worrying about their [stoning](/wiki/Stoning "Stoning") touch or their corpses.[Vegetarian](/wiki/Vegetarian "Vegetarian"), [vegan](/wiki/Vegan "Vegan") and [foodless](/wiki/Foodless "Foodless") [Monks](/wiki/Monk "Monk") that opt for body armor and cover [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") and [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") via other means may consider yellow scales to avoid breaking the [conducts](/wiki/Conduct "Conduct").

## History

Yellow dragon scales first appear with most other colors of dragon scales in [NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0").

## Variants

- *Main article: [Dragon-scaled armor](/wiki/Dragon-scaled_armor "Dragon-scaled armor")*

In some variants, dragon scale mail is phased out in favor of dragon-scaled armor, whose implementation is based on a proposal by dtsund - instead of being made into mail of its own, dragon scales are treated as a [cloak](/wiki/Cloak "Cloak"), and reading a scroll of enchant armor melds them onto a worn set of body armor, generally augmenting that armor by adding its AC and conferred extrinsic properties to it. Dragon-scaled armor is implemented in [NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk"), [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM").

Several variants also give yellow dragon scales additional properties while worn, and variants that implement partial intrinsics and/or [object properties](/wiki/Object_properties "Object properties") may also make yellow dragon scales and other colors more worthwhile.

### SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, acid damage is much more of a threat in the mid- and late-game due to the introduction of new [jellies](/wiki/Jellies "Jellies") and the dreaded [shoggoth](/wiki/Shoggoth_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Shoggoth (SLASH'EM)") and [giant shoggoth](/wiki/Giant_shoggoth "Giant shoggoth"), making yellow dragon scales more desirable to seek out and make into mail for a character that has reflection, magic resistance, and [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance") covered.

### SporkHack

In [SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack"), worn yellow dragon scales additionally confer [stun resistance](/index.php?title=Stun_resistance\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Stun resistance (page does not exist)") and [confusion resistance](/index.php?title=Confusion_resistance\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Confusion resistance (page does not exist)").

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), dragon scales and dragon scale mail have randomized powers and [appearances](/wiki/Randomized_appearance "Randomized appearance") in each game - to [wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for dragon armor or scales by its corresponding power, either type of armor must be formally identified first, e.g. by using a [scroll of identify](/wiki/Scroll_of_identify "Scroll of identify") on dropped dragon scales (which identifies the matching scale mail along with it) or by witnessing the dragon use its breath weapon.

Yellow dragon scales are effectively replaced by **acid dragon scales**, which confer only 1 base AC like all dragon scales in UnNetHack.

### dNetHack

- *Main article: [Dragon armor (dNetHack)](/wiki/Dragon_armor_\(dNetHack\) "Dragon armor (dNetHack)")*

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), worn yellow dragon scales additionally confer stoning resistance. Dragon scales also weigh 150 aum.

### FIQHack

In [FIQHack](/wiki/FIQHack "FIQHack"), worn yellow dragon scales additionally confer stoning resistance, and weigh 300 aum like all dragon scales in FIQHack (which is halved while worn).
